abstract: The query URL component as an array of name/value pairs.
overview:
## Discussion

When you get this property’s value, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] class parses the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] string and returns an array of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLQueryItem] objects, each of which represents a single key-value pair, in the order in which they appear in the original query string. Because a name may appear more than once in a single query string, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLQueryItem/name] properties of query items are not guaranteed to be unique. If the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property is an empty string, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] property is an empty array. If the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property is `nil`, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] property is also `nil`.

When you set this property’s value, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] class joins each name/value pair with a `=` delimiter and joins the array with a `&` delimiter, then sets the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property to the resulting string. Setting the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] property to an empty array sets the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property to an empty string, and setting the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] property to `nil` sets the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property to `nil`.

To ensure you can compose and decompose URL queries even with empty components, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] class has the following behavior for cases where no name or value is present:

For example, in the URL `http://www.example.com/index.php?key1=value1&key2=value2`, this property’s value is an array of two [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLQueryItem] objects: one whose name property is `key1` and whose value property is `value1`, and one whose name property is `key2` and whose value property is `value2`.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems
crawled: 2025-12-05T04:13:01Z
---

# queryItems

**Instance Property**

The query URL component as an array of name/value pairs.

## Declaration

```swift
var queryItems: [URLQueryItem]? { get set }
```

## Discussion

When you get this property’s value, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] class parses the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] string and returns an array of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLQueryItem] objects, each of which represents a single key-value pair, in the order in which they appear in the original query string. Because a name may appear more than once in a single query string, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLQueryItem/name] properties of query items are not guaranteed to be unique. If the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property is an empty string, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] property is an empty array. If the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property is `nil`, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] property is also `nil`.

When you set this property’s value, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] class joins each name/value pair with a `=` delimiter and joins the array with a `&` delimiter, then sets the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property to the resulting string. Setting the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] property to an empty array sets the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property to an empty string, and setting the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] property to `nil` sets the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/query] property to `nil`.



To ensure you can compose and decompose URL queries even with empty components, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] class has the following behavior for cases where no name or value is present:

- If a name-value pair has nothing before its equals sign, the `name` property of the corresponding query item is a zero-length string.
- If a name-value pair has nothing after its equals sign, the `value` property of the corresponding query item is a zero-length string.
- If a name-value pair has no equals sign, the `value` property of the corresponding query item is `nil`.
- If a name-value pair is empty (that is, the `query` string starts with `&`, ends with `&`, or contains `&``&`), the corresponding query item has a zero-length `name` and `nil` `value`.

For example, in the URL `http://www.example.com/index.php?key1=value1&key2=value2`, this property’s value is an array of two [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLQueryItem] objects: one whose name property is `key1` and whose value property is `value1`, and one whose name property is `key2` and whose value property is `value2`.

## Accessing components in native format

- **fragment**: The fragment URL component (the part after a `#` symbol), or nil if not present.
- **host**: The host URL subcomponent, or nil if not present.
- **encodedHost**: The host subcomponent, percent-encoded.
- **password**: The password URL subcomponent, or nil if not present.
- **path**: The path URL component, or nil if not present.
- **port**: The port number URL component, or nil if not present.
- **query**: The query URL component as a string, or nil if not present.
- **scheme**: The scheme URL component, or nil if not present.
- **user**: The username URL subcomponent, or nil if not present.
